intro: Argostemma lanceolarium, commonly known as the lanceleaf argostemma, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are usually smooth and glossy. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and typically have five petals. It is often grown as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and delicate floral display.
